title: Containers X and Y in thermal contact

content.question: Two identical containers, <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, each contain one mole of an ideal monatomic gas. The atoms in container <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> have a higher average kinetic energy than those in container <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The containers are thermally insulated from the external environment and placed into thermal contact with each other at time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following accurately describes the interactions between containers <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The net result is that energy is transferred from container <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to container <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The amount of energy transferred between the containers depends on the type of atoms each contains.

After equilibrium is reached, the atoms in container <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> will still have a different average kinetic energy than those in container <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

All the atoms in container <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> slow down, and all the atoms in container <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> speed up.

content.answer: The net result is that energy is transferred from container <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to container <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.
